node.title: Sam is trapped in Katherine as COVID cases grow. And he's not the only one
node.alt: An Aboriginal man sitting cross-legged on a patch of grass, wearing a surgical face mask.
node.description: As KatherineÂ grapples with the NT's biggest COVID-19 outbreak to date, Sam Ashley has been sleeping on a patch of grass near the river.
node.content:
["As Katherine and nearby communities\u00a0grapples with the NT's worst COVID-19 outbreak to date, Sam Ashley has been sleeping\u00a0on a patch of grass near the town's\u00a0river.", "One morning around 4am,\u00a0he was woken by the spray of sprinklers.", "It drenched his blankets and his clothing, but Mr Ashley, who is in his 60s, had no choice but to move his makeshift bed and try to get back to sleep.", "\"I'm out here, in town, I've got nowhere to really sleep,\" Mr Ashley said.", "\"Why should I be out there where I should be somewhere else, a home, or maybe in somewhere like a hotel, a safety place?\"", "Mr Ashley lives in Beswick, roughly 118 kilometres south east of Katherine.", "Like many others, Mr Ashley travelled to Katherine for food and supplies and is now stuck as the number of COVID-19 cases grows around him.", "The Katherine and Robinson River cluster\u00a0is now at 19, all of whom are Aboriginal Territorians.", "\"We can't get home,\" Mr Ashley", "\"It got me really worried.\"", "", "
Eli Sherman from the Katherine Salvation Army Hub is helping to hand out food and water to those living in the long grass during lockdown.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "
'Huge influx' of new clients
", "Eli Sherman is the coordinator at the Katherine Salvation Army Hub.", "He says he has\u00a0met a lot of people who have been trapped in Katherine during the outbreak.", "\"We've identified a huge influx over the last, probably, six weeks to the fact of about 130 to 150 people frequenting our service,\" Mr Sherman said.", "Mr Sherman said there was no \"quick answer\" for those trapped in the town.", "\"Some are very scared,\" he said.", "On Wednesday, Mr Sherman's team handed out about 130 meals and the demand shows\u00a0no sign of slowing down.", "They've also been making sure people are keeping their distance, have masks\u00a0and understand the health rules \u2014\u00a0especially important for people who don't speak English as a first language.", "According to government statistics, the homelessness rate in Katherine is twice the NT average and 31 times the national rate.", "Like other advocates in Katherine, Mr Sherman wants the NT Government to step in and help the town's rough sleepers.", "\"From a housing perspective, this is a significant time for the government to do some action for the homeless population of Katherine,\" he said.", "\"Organisations in town, they've been screaming out for quite some time.\"", "", "
The streets of the normally bustling town of Katherine are quiet as the town's lockdown enters its fourth day.(ABC News:\u00a0Michael Franchi)
", "
Sleeping rough a 'choice' for some, says Chief Minister
", "Mr Gunner said the government had met with the Aboriginal community-controlled health services to coordinate \"welfare supports\" and mobile vaccinations and testing.", "He said the government would \"work with anyone who wants to relocate\" but needed to seek more information about possible accommodation arrangements in Katherine.", "The ABC has contacted the government for updated information.", "Mr Gunner said some extra rooms made available during a previous lockdown in Darwin \"were not taken up\".", "\"I want to be clear, unfortunately, it is a choice,\" Mr Gunner said.", "\"People don't always want to leave those circumstances.\"", "NT Police Commissioner Jamie Chalker said police did not have the \"power\" to order people into accommodation.", "\"At the end of the day, people have the right to make a decision as to where they choose to live.\"", "Katherine Mayor Elisabeth Clark said the town was \"feeling very worried\" about the growing cluster across Darwin and Robinson River.", "Ms Clark was bracing for the news of more cases today.", "\"It's going to be very difficult, until we know who the original contact person was, it makes it very difficult to work out how many other people have been infected with COVID,\" she said.", "Ms Clark urged Katherine residents to get vaccinated, wear their masks and get tested if they showed any symptoms at all.", "", "
